guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for aripiprazole and CYP2D6

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166301981

text.html: The guideline does not provide a recommendation for aripiprazole in normal metabolizers.

implications: The guideline does not provide a description of the impact of a normal metabolizer phenotype on aripiprazole.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166301980

text.html: NO action is needed for this gene-drug interaction.

implications: The genetic variation decreases the plasma concentration of the sum of aripiprazole and the active metabolite dehydroaripiprazole to a limited degree. There is no evidence that this increases the risk of reduced effectiveness.

recommendations.name: Recommendation Annotation PA166301969

text.html: Administer no more than 10 mg/day or 300 mg/month (68-75% of the normal maximum dose of aripiprazole).

implications: The risk of side effects is increased. The genetic variation leads to an increase in the sum of the plasma concentrations of aripiprazole and the active metabolite.
